Welcome Sequence (New User Onboarding) ### Email 1: Welcome to Spark (Immediate) **Subject:** Welcome to Spark - Your journey to real love starts now **Preview:** Let's get you set up for success... --- Hi [First Name], Welcome to Spark! We're thrilled you've taken the first step toward finding something real. You're joining over 5 million singles who believe in quality over quantity, genuine connections over endless swiping, and finding someone who truly gets them. **Here's what makes Spark different:** - Smart compatibility matching based on 50+ factors - Every profile is photo-verified (no catfish here) - Video dating to connect before you meet - AI-powered conversation starters when you need them **Your first step:** Complete your profile to start seeing matches. [Complete My Profile - Button] The more you tell us about yourself, the better your matches will be. Be authentic - the right person is looking for exactly who you are. Here's to finding your person, The Spark Team P.S. Need inspiration for your bio? Reply to this email and we'll send you our top-performing bio templates. --- ### Email 2: Profile Tips (Day 1) **Subject:** 3 profile tweaks that 10x your matches **Preview:** What successful Spark users do differently... --- Hey [First Name], Fun fact: Users who complete these 3 profile elements get 10x more quality matches on Spark. **1. Add 4-6 photos (including one activity shot)** Show different sides of yourself. Your first photo should be a clear face shot. Include at least one photo doing something you love. **2. Write a bio that invites conversation** Instead of: "Love to travel and try new food" Try: "Just got back from Japan and I'm obsessed with finding authentic ramen in the city. Know any spots?" **3. Answer at least 3 personality prompts** These help our algorithm AND give your matches something to talk about. [Optimize My Profile - Button] Here's a secret: Our algorithm prioritizes showing complete profiles to other complete profiles. Quality attracts quality. Happy matching, The Spark Team --- ### Email 3: First Match Tips (Day 2) **Subject:** What to do when you get your first match **Preview:** The first message makes all the difference... --- Hey [First Name], Matches are coming in, and we want to make sure you're set up for great conversations. **The art of the first message:** Don't: "Hey" "Hi" "What's up" Do: Reference something specific from their profile **Example openers that work:** - "I saw you're into hiking - what's the best trail you've done recently?" - "A fellow [TV show] fan! Team [character] or team [character]?" - "That photo in [location] looks amazing. What was the highlight of that trip?" **Pro tip:** Stuck? Tap the lightbulb icon on any profile and our AI will suggest personalized openers based on their interests. [Open Spark - Button] The goal isn't just to match - it's to connect. Make that first message count. Cheers, The Spark Team --- ### Email 4: Video Dating Feature (Day 4) **Subject:** Ready to video date? Here's how it works **Preview:** See the chemistry before you meet... --- Hey [First Name], You've been chatting with some great matches. Ready to take it to the next level? **Introducing Video Dating on Spark** Before you commit to meeting up, hop on a quick video call right in the app. It's the perfect way to: - Check if the chemistry translates IRL - Make sure they match their photos (safety first!) - Skip the awkward "are they who they say they are" anxiety - Have a real conversation before spending time/money on a date **How it works:** 1. Match with someone and start chatting 2. When you're ready, tap the video icon 3. They'll get a notification to accept 4. Enjoy a video date from the comfort of home [Try Video Dating - Button] Over 70% of Spark users who video date before meeting say it made their first in-person date way better. Go connect, The Spark Team --- ### Email 5: Premium Features (Day 7) **Subject:** You're doing great - want to see who's interested? **Preview:** Unlock features that get you more dates... --- Hey [First Name], You've been on Spark for a week now, and you're crushing it! **Your stats so far:** - Profile views: [X] - Matches: [X] - Conversations: [X] Want to accelerate your journey? Here's what Spark Premium unlocks: **See Who Likes You** Skip the guessing game. See everyone who's already interested. **Unlimited Rewinds** Accidentally swiped left on "the one"? Go back and fix it. **5 Super Likes Daily** Stand out from the crowd and get noticed faster. **Read Receipts** Know when your messages are read. **Advanced Filters** Get more specific about what you're looking for. [Upgrade to Premium - Button] Premium users get 3x more dates on average. Just saying. To finding your person faster, The Spark Team --- ## 2. Re-Engagement Sequence (Inactive Users) ### Email 1: We Miss You (7 Days Inactive) **Subject:** [First Name], your matches miss you **Preview:** Some great people are waiting to meet you... --- Hey [First Name], We noticed you haven't been on Spark lately. Life gets busy - we get it! But while you've been away, some pretty great people have been checking out your profile. **Here's what you've missed:** - [X] new profile views - [X] new likes waiting for you - [X] new matches in your area Your perfect match could be one swipe away. Don't leave them hanging! [Open Spark - Button] If something's not working for you, reply to this email. We read every response and we're always improving. Hoping to see you back, The Spark Team --- ### Email 2: What Changed? (14 Days Inactive) **Subject:** Did we do something wrong? **Preview:** We want to make Spark better for you... --- Hey [First Name], It's been a couple weeks since we've seen you on Spark, and honestly, we're wondering if something's up. **Quick question:** What made you step away? A) Not enough quality matches B) Conversations weren't going anywhere C) Too busy right now D) Found someone (congrats if so!) E) Something else Just reply with a letter - we read every response and use feedback to make Spark better. **In case you missed it, here's what's new:** - Improved matching algorithm (quality is way up) - New conversation starters feature - Enhanced video dating experience - More verified profiles than ever [Give Spark Another Try - Button] We're committed to being the dating app that actually works. Help us help you find love. Thanks for your honesty, The Spark Team --- ### Email 3: Special Offer (21 Days Inactive) **Subject:** Come back and get a week of Premium - on us **Preview:** We want to prove Spark works... --- Hey [First Name], We really want you to experience the best of Spark. So here's the deal: **Come back this week and get 7 days of Premium absolutely free.** That means: - See everyone who likes you - Unlimited rewinds - 5 Super Likes daily - Read receipts - Advanced filters No credit card needed. No strings attached. Just come back and see what you've been missing. [Claim My Free Week - Button] This offer expires in 72 hours. Your potential matches are waiting. Let's find your person, The Spark Team --- ### Email 4: Final Reach Out (30 Days Inactive) **Subject:** Last call, [First Name] **Preview:** Before we stop reaching out... --- Hey [First Name], This is our last email for a while (we promise we're not trying to be annoying). We just wanted to say: whenever you're ready to find something real, Spark will be here. **A few things before we go:** 1. Your profile is still active and getting views 2. We've made some big improvements lately 3. Over 150,000 couples have found love on Spark Dating is hard. We're trying to make it easier. When you're ready to give it another shot, we'll be here. [Maybe Later - Reduce email frequency] [I'm Ready - Open Spark] Wishing you all the best, The Spark Team P.S. Found love elsewhere? That's amazing! Let us know and we'll celebrate with you. Reply "found someone" and we'll take you off our list. --- ## 3. Match Milestone Emails ### First Match **Subject:** You got your first match! **Preview:** [Match name] is interested in you... --- Hey [First Name], Exciting news - you just got your first match on Spark! **[Match Name]** liked your profile back. Based on your compatibility scores, we think this could be a great connection. **What you have in common:** - [Shared interest 1] - [Shared interest 2] - [Shared interest 3] Don't leave them waiting! The best conversations start within the first hour of matching. [Send a Message - Button] Need help breaking the ice? Tap the lightbulb icon for personalized conversation starters. Good luck! The Spark Team --- ### 10th Match **Subject:** 10 matches and counting! **Preview:** You're officially a Spark pro... --- Hey [First Name], Double digits! You've hit 10 matches on Spark. You're clearly doing something right. **Quick tip for managing multiple conversations:** Focus your energy on 3-5 conversations at a time. Quality over quantity applies to conversations too. It's better to have a few great chats than a dozen surface-level ones. **Your top matches by compatibility:** 1. [Name] - [X]% match 2. [Name] - [X]% match 3. [Name] - [X]% match These are your highest-scoring connections. Worth prioritizing! [Open Spark - Button] Keep the momentum going, The Spark Team --- ## 4. Upgrade/Conversion Emails ### Post-Trial End **Subject:** Your Premium trial ended - but it doesn't have to **Preview:** Keep the features you love... --- Hey [First Name], Your 7-day Premium trial just ended. Here's what you accomplished: - Saw [X] people who liked you - Used [X] rewinds to recover great matches - Sent [X] Super Likes - Had [X] read receipts **Your results with Premium were [X]% better than average.** Don't go back to the basics now. Keep the momentum going. **Limited time offer:** Get 30% off your first month of Premium. [Upgrade Now - 30% Off - Button] Offer expires in 48 hours. To finding your person, The Spark Team --- ### "Out of Likes" Trigger **Subject:** You've used all your daily likes **Preview:** Want unlimited? Here's how... --- Hey [First Name], You're clearly seeing some great people on Spark today - you've used all your daily likes! Good news: With Premium, you get **unlimited likes** so you never miss a potential match. Plus: - See who already likes you - 5 Super Likes daily - Unlimited rewinds - And more [Upgrade to Premium - Button] Your daily likes will refresh in [X] hours. Or upgrade now and keep swiping. The Spark Team --- ## 5. Success Story Request ### Post-Relationship Status Change **Subject:** We're so happy for you! **Preview:** Would you share your story? --- Hey [First Name], We noticed you're no longer active on Spark. If it's because you found someone special, we couldn't be happier for you! We'd love to hear your story. Spark success stories inspire millions of singles to keep believing in finding love. **Would you mind sharing?** - How did you match? - What was your first conversation like? - What made you know they were special? [Share My Story - Button] Whether it's a few sentences or your whole journey, we'd be honored to feature you (with your permission, of course). Wishing you all the love, The Spark Team P.S. Couples who share their stories sometimes get featured on our social media and receive exclusive Spark merchandise! --- ## Email Design Guidelines ### Visual Style - Clean, minimal design with lots of white space - Primary CTA button: Coral/salmon gradient (#FF6B6B to #FF8E53) - Secondary text: Dark gray (#333333) - Accent color for highlights: Teal (#4ECDC4) ### Best Practices - Subject lines: 6-10 words, personalization when possible - Preview text: Complete the thought, create curiosity - Single primary CTA per email - Mobile-optimized (60%+ open on mobile) - Unsubscribe link clearly visible ### Sending Times - Welcome sequence: Based on signup time - Re-engagement: Tuesday-Thursday, 10am or 7pm local - Promotional: Wednesday or Thursday, 11am local - Match notifications: Real-time "}

file.content:
version: '3.8'

services:
  # PostgreSQL Database
  postgres:
    image: postgres:15-alpine
    container_name: dating-platform-db
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      POSTGRES_DB: ${POSTGRES_DB:-dating_platform}
      POSTGRES_USER: ${POSTGRES_USER:-postgres}
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:-your_secure_password}
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
      - ./database/init:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d
    ports:
      - "${POSTGRES_PORT:-5432}:5432"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U ${POSTGRES_USER:-postgres}"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5
    networks:
      - dating-network

  # Redis Cache
  redis:
    image: redis:7-alpine
    container_name: dating-platform-redis
    restart: unless-stopped
    command: redis-server --appendonly yes --requirepass ${REDIS_PASSWORD:-your_redis_password}
    volumes:
      - redis_data:/data
    ports:
      - "${REDIS_PORT:-6379}:6379"
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "redis-cli", "ping"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5
    networks:
      - dating-network

  # Backend API
  backend:
    build:
      context: ./backend
      dockerfile: Dockerfile
    container_name: dating-platform-api
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      NODE_ENV: ${NODE_ENV:-production}
      PORT: 3000
      DATABASE_URL: postgresql://${POSTGRES_USER:-postgres}:${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:-your_secure_password}@postgres:5432/${POSTGRES_DB:-dating_platform}
      REDIS_URL: redis://:${REDIS_PASSWORD:-your_redis_password}@redis:6379
      JWT_SECRET: ${JWT_SECRET:-your_jwt_secret_here}
      SQUARE_ACCESS_TOKEN: ${SQUARE_ACCESS_TOKEN}
      SQUARE_APPLICATION_ID: ${SQUARE_APPLICATION_ID}
      SQUARE_LOCATION_ID: ${SQUARE_LOCATION_ID}
      SQUARE_ENVIRONMENT: ${SQUARE_ENVIRONMENT:-production}
      FRONTEND_URL: ${FRONTEND_URL:-http://localhost:8080}
      AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: ${AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID}
      AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: ${AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY}
      AWS_S3_BUCKET: ${AWS_S3_BUCKET}
      AWS_REGION: ${AWS_REGION:-us-east-1}
      SMTP_HOST: ${SMTP_HOST}
      SMTP_PORT: ${SMTP_PORT:-587}
      SMTP_USER: ${SMTP_USER}
      SMTP_PASS: ${SMTP_PASS}
      EMAIL_FROM: ${EMAIL_FROM:-noreply@yourdomain.com}
    ports:
      - "${API_PORT:-3000}:3000"
    depends_on:
      postgres:
        condition: service_healthy
      redis:
        condition: service_healthy
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "curl", "-f", "http://localhost:3000/health"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 40s
    networks:
      - dating-network

  # Frontend (Static files served by nginx)
  frontend:
    image: nginx:alpine
    container_name: dating-platform-frontend
    restart: unless-stopped
    volumes:
      - ./frontend:/usr/share/nginx/html:ro
      - ./nginx/nginx.conf:/etc/nginx/nginx.conf:ro
      - ./nginx/default.conf:/etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf:ro
    ports:
      - "${FRONTEND_PORT:-8080}:80"
    depends_on:
      - backend
    networks:
      - dating-network

  # Admin Dashboard
  admin:
    build:
      context: ./admin
      dockerfile: Dockerfile.admin
    container_name: dating-platform-admin
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      VITE_API_URL: ${ADMIN_API_URL:-http://localhost:3000/api}
    ports:
      - "${ADMIN_PORT:-3001}:80"
    depends_on:
      - backend
    networks:
      - dating-network

  # Prisma Studio (Development only)
  prisma-studio:
    image: node:18-alpine
    container_name: dating-platform-prisma
    working_dir: /app
    command: npx prisma studio --port 5555 --browser none
    environment:
      DATABASE_URL: postgresql://${POSTGRES_USER:-postgres}:${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:-your_secure_password}@postgres:5432/${POSTGRES_DB:-dating_platform}
    ports:
      - "${PRISMA_STUDIO_PORT:-5555}:5555"
    volumes:
      - ./database/prisma:/app/prisma
      - ./backend/node_modules:/app/node_modules
    depends_on:
      postgres:
        condition: service_healthy
    networks:
      - dating-network
    profiles:
      - development

volumes:
  postgres_data:
    driver: local
  redis_data:
    driver: local

networks:
  dating-network:
    driver: bridge

content.content:
1# Complete Dating Platform - White-Label Ready
     2
     3A comprehensive, production-ready dating platform solution designed for entrepreneurs and businesses looking to launch their own dating service. This white-label solution includes everything you need to deploy, customize, and scale your dating application.
     4
     5## Product Overview
     6
     7**Price: $2,499** | **License: Commercial Use**
     8
     9### What's Included
    10
    11- **Frontend Application** - Responsive landing pages and user interface
    12- **Backend API** - Node.js/Express server with full authentication
    13- **Admin Dashboard** - React-based control panel for platform management
    14- **Database Schema** - Complete PostgreSQL schema with Prisma ORM
    15- **Docker Configuration** - Production-ready containerization
    16- **Payment Integration** - Square payment processing (MCC 7273 compliant)
    17- **Documentation** - Comprehensive setup and deployment guides
    18
    19## Key Features
    20
    21### User Features
    22- Profile creation with photo uploads
    23- Advanced matching algorithm
    24- Real-time messaging
    25- Super likes and profile boosts
    26- Location-based discovery
    27- Push notifications
    28
    29### Admin Features
    30- User management dashboard
    31- Content moderation tools
    32- Revenue analytics
    33- Subscription management
    34- Report handling
    35- Platform configuration
    36
    37### Technical Features
    38- RESTful API architecture
    39- WebSocket support for real-time features
    40- Redis caching for performance
    41- S3-compatible photo storage
    42- Email notifications
    43- Age verification integration
    44- GDPR/CCPA compliance tools
    45
    46## Quick Start
    47
    48### Prerequisites
    49
    50- Node.js 18+
    51- Docker & Docker Compose
    52- PostgreSQL 15+
    53- Redis 7+
    54
    55### Installation
    56
    571. **Clone the repository**
    58   ```bash
    59   git clone https://github.com/your-org/dating-platform.git
    60   cd dating-platform
    61   ```
    62
    632. **Configure environment**
    64   ```bash
    65   cp .env.example .env
    66   # Edit .env with your configuration
    67   ```
    68
    693. **Start with Docker**
    70   ```bash
    71   docker-compose up -d
    72   ```
    73
    744. **Run database migrations**
    75   ```bash
    76   cd backend
    77   npx prisma migrate deploy
    78   npx prisma db seed
    79   ```
    80
    815. **Access the application**
    82   - Frontend: http://localhost:8080
    83   - Admin: http://localhost:3001
    84   - API: http://localhost:3000
    85
    86## Project Structure
    87
    88```
    89dating-platform/
    90 frontend/           # Landing pages and static assets
    91 backend/            # Node.js API server
    92    routes/         # API route handlers
    93    services/       # Business logic
    94    middleware/     # Auth, validation, etc.
    95    prisma/         # Database schema
    96 admin/              # React admin dashboard
    97    src/
    98       components/ # UI components
    99       pages/      # Dashboard views
   100       services/   # API integration
   101 database/
   102    prisma/         # Schema definitions
   103    migrations/     # Database migrations
   104    seed.js         # Sample data
   105 docker-compose.yml  # Container orchestration
   106 docs/               # Documentation
   107```
   108
   109## Documentation
   110
   111- [DEPLOYMENT.md](./DEPLOYMENT.md) - Full deployment guide
   112- [DATABASE-SETUP.md](./DATABASE-SETUP.md) - Database configuration
   113- [PAYMENT-SETUP.md](./PAYMENT-SETUP.md) - Square integration guide
   114- [SECURITY.md](./SECURITY.md) - Security best practices
   115- [COMPLIANCE.md](./COMPLIANCE.md) - Regulatory compliance
   116
   117## Customization
   118
   119### Branding
   1201. Update logo and colors in `admin/src/index.css`
   1212. Modify frontend templates in `frontend/`
   1223. Configure email templates in `backend/templates/`
   123
   124### Features
   1251. Adjust matching algorithm in `backend/services/matching.js`
   1262. Customize subscription tiers in admin dashboard
   1273. Add new profile fields via Prisma schema
   128
   129## API Documentation
   130
   131API endpoints are documented using OpenAPI specification. Access the interactive documentation at `/api/docs` when running the backend.
   132
   133### Key Endpoints
   134
   135| Endpoint | Method | Description |
   136|----------|--------|-------------|

file.content:
# Complete Dating Platform - White-Label Ready

A comprehensive, production-ready dating platform solution designed for entrepreneurs and businesses looking to launch their own dating service. This white-label solution includes everything you need to deploy, customize, and scale your dating application.

## Product Overview

**Price: $2,499** | **License: Commercial Use**

### What's Included

- **Frontend Application** - Responsive landing pages and user interface
- **Backend API** - Node.js/Express server with full authentication
- **Admin Dashboard** - React-based control panel for platform management
- **Database Schema** - Complete PostgreSQL schema with Prisma ORM
- **Docker Configuration** - Production-ready containerization
- **Payment Integration** - Square payment processing (MCC 7273 compliant)
- **Documentation** - Comprehensive setup and deployment guides

## Key Features

### User Features
- Profile creation with photo uploads
- Advanced matching algorithm
- Real-time messaging
- Super likes and profile boosts
- Location-based discovery
- Push notifications

### Admin Features
- User management dashboard
- Content moderation tools
- Revenue analytics
- Subscription management
- Report handling
- Platform configuration

### Technical Features
- RESTful API architecture
- WebSocket support for real-time features
- Redis caching for performance
- S3-compatible photo storage
- Email notifications
- Age verification integration
- GDPR/CCPA compliance tools

## Quick Start

### Prerequisites

- Node.js 18+
- Docker & Docker Compose
- PostgreSQL 15+
- Redis 7+

### Installation

1. **Clone the repository**
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/your-org/dating-platform.git
   cd dating-platform
   ```

2. **Configure environment**
   ```bash
   cp .env.example .env
   # Edit .env with your configuration
   ```

3. **Start with Docker**
   ```bash
   docker-compose up -d
   ```

4. **Run database migrations**
   ```bash
   cd backend
   npx prisma migrate deploy
   npx prisma db seed
   ```

5. **Access the application**
   - Frontend: http://localhost:8080
   - Admin: http://localhost:3001
   - API: http://localhost:3000

## Project Structure

```
dating-platform/
 frontend/           # Landing pages and static assets
 backend/            # Node.js API server
    routes/         # API route handlers
    services/       # Business logic
    middleware/     # Auth, validation, etc.
    prisma/         # Database schema
 admin/              # React admin dashboard
    src/
       components/ # UI components
       pages/      # Dashboard views
       services/   # API integration
 database/
    prisma/         # Schema definitions
    migrations/     # Database migrations
    seed.js         # Sample data
 docker-compose.yml  # Container orchestration
 docs/               # Documentation
```

## Documentation

- [DEPLOYMENT.md](./DEPLOYMENT.md) - Full deployment guide
- [DATABASE-SETUP.md](./DATABASE-SETUP.md) - Database configuration
- [PAYMENT-SETUP.md](./PAYMENT-SETUP.md) - Square integration guide
- [SECURITY.md](./SECURITY.md) - Security best practices
- [COMPLIANCE.md](./COMPLIANCE.md) - Regulatory compliance

## Customization

### Branding
1. Update logo and colors in `admin/src/index.css`
2. Modify frontend templates in `frontend/`
3. Configure email templates in `backend/templates/`

### Features
1. Adjust matching algorithm in `backend/services/matching.js`
2. Customize subscription tiers in admin dashboard
3. Add new profile fields via Prisma schema

## API Documentation

API endpoints are documented using OpenAPI specification. Access the interactive documentation at `/api/docs` when running the backend.

### Key Endpoints

| Endpoint | Method | Description |
|----------|--------|-------------|
| `/api/auth/register` | POST | User registration |
| `/api/auth/login` | POST | User authentication |
| `/api/profiles` | GET | Browse profiles |
| `/api/matches` | GET | View matches |
| `/api/messages` | POST | Send message |
| `/api/subscriptions` | POST | Subscribe to plan |

## Support

### Commercial License

This product includes:
- 1 year of email support
- Access to updates and bug fixes
- Deployment assistance (first install)

### Community

- Documentation: See included docs
- Issues: GitHub Issues
- Updates: Watch this repository

## Requirements

### Server Requirements
- 2+ CPU cores
- 4GB+ RAM
- 50GB+ SSD storage
- SSL certificate

### Recommended Services
- AWS/GCP/Azure for hosting
- CloudFlare for CDN
- Square for payments
- SendGrid/SES for email
- S3/R2 for photo storage

## Version History

### v1.0.0 (Current)
- Initial release
- Complete user management
- Matching and messaging
- Payment integration
- Admin dashboard
- Docker support

## License

Commercial License - See LICENSE file for terms.

Copyright (c) 2024. All rights reserved.

---

**Ready to launch your dating platform?**

For questions or custom development inquiries, please contact us through the repository.

Launch maximum marketing campaign
Deploy and test on this machine (9020 i7K)
Set up T5500 for automation overflow

[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/docker-compose.yml","content":"version: '3.8'

services:
  # PostgreSQL Database
  postgres:
    image: postgres:16-alpine
    container_name: dateapp-postgres
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: ${POSTGRES_USER:-dateapp}
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:?POSTGRES_PASSWORD is required}
      POSTGRES_DB: ${POSTGRES_DB:-dateapp}
      PGDATA: /var/lib/postgresql/data/pgdata
    ports:
      - "${POSTGRES_PORT:-5432}:5432"
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
      - ./init-scripts:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d:ro
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U ${POSTGRES_USER:-dateapp} -d ${POSTGRES_DB:-dateapp}"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5
      start_period: 30s
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Redis Cache & Session Store
  redis:
    image: redis:7-alpine
    container_name: dateapp-redis
    restart: unless-stopped
    command: redis-server --appendonly yes --requirepass ${REDIS_PASSWORD:?REDIS_PASSWORD is required}
    ports:
      - "${REDIS_PORT:-6379}:6379"
    volumes:
      - redis_data:/data
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "redis-cli", "-a", "${REDIS_PASSWORD}", "ping"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5
      start_period: 10s
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Ollama - Llama AI Service
  ollama:
    image: ollama/ollama:latest
    container_name: dateapp-ollama
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "${OLLAMA_PORT:-11434}:11434"
    volumes:
      - ollama_data:/root/.ollama
    environment:
      - OLLAMA_HOST=0.0.0.0
      - OLLAMA_ORIGINS=*
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -f http://localhost:11434/api/tags || exit 1"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 60s
    deploy:
      resources:
        reservations:
          devices:
            - driver: nvidia
              count: all
              capabilities: [gpu]
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Node.js Backend API
  backend:
    build:
      context: ../backend
      dockerfile: ../docker/Dockerfile.backend
      args:
        NODE_ENV: ${NODE_ENV:-production}
    container_name: dateapp-backend
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      NODE_ENV: ${NODE_ENV:-production}
      PORT: 3001
      DATABASE_URL: postgresql://${POSTGRES_USER:-dateapp}:${POSTGRES_PASSWORD}@postgres:5432/${POSTGRES_DB:-dateapp}?schema=public
      REDIS_URL: redis://:${REDIS_PASSWORD}@redis:6379
      REDIS_HOST: redis
      REDIS_PORT: 6379
      REDIS_PASSWORD: ${REDIS_PASSWORD}
      JWT_SECRET: ${JWT_SECRET:?JWT_SECRET is required}
      JWT_REFRESH_SECRET: ${JWT_REFRESH_SECRET:?JWT_REFRESH_SECRET is required}
      JWT_EXPIRES_IN: ${JWT_EXPIRES_IN:-15m}
      JWT_REFRESH_EXPIRES_IN: ${JWT_REFRESH_EXPIRES_IN:-7d}
      OLLAMA_BASE_URL: http://ollama:11434
      OLLAMA_MODEL: ${OLLAMA_MODEL:-llama3.2}
      CORS_ORIGIN: ${CORS_ORIGIN:-http://localhost:3000}
      UPLOAD_DIR: /app/uploads
      MAX_FILE_SIZE: ${MAX_FILE_SIZE:-10485760}
      RATE_LIMIT_WINDOW_MS: ${RATE_LIMIT_WINDOW_MS:-900000}
      RATE_LIMIT_MAX_REQUESTS: ${RATE_LIMIT_MAX_REQUESTS:-100}
    ports:
      - "${BACKEND_PORT:-3001}:3001"
    volumes:
      - backend_uploads:/app/uploads
      - backend_logs:/app/logs
    depends_on:
      postgres:
        condition: service_healthy
      redis:
        condition: service_healthy
      ollama:
        condition: service_started
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -f http://localhost:3001/health || exit 1"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 40s
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Next.js Frontend
  frontend:
    build:
      context: ../frontend
      dockerfile: ../docker/Dockerfile.frontend
      args:
        NODE_ENV: ${NODE_ENV:-production}
        NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL:-http://localhost:3001}
        NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL:-ws://localhost:3001}
        NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME:-DateApp}
    container_name: dateapp-frontend
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      NODE_ENV: ${NODE_ENV:-production}
      NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL:-http://localhost:3001}
      NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL:-ws://localhost:3001}
      NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME:-DateApp}
    ports:
      - "${FRONTEND_PORT:-3000}:3000"
    depends_on:
      backend:
        condition: service_healthy
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -f http://localhost:3000 || exit 1"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 60s
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Nginx Reverse Proxy
  nginx:
    image: nginx:alpine
    container_name: dateapp-nginx
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "${NGINX_HTTP_PORT:-80}:80"
      - "${NGINX_HTTPS_PORT:-443}:443"
    volumes:
      - ./nginx/nginx.conf:/etc/nginx/nginx.conf:ro
      - ./nginx/conf.d:/etc/nginx/conf.d:ro
      - ./nginx/ssl:/etc/nginx/ssl:ro
      - nginx_logs:/var/log/nginx
      - ./nginx/html:/usr/share/nginx/html:ro
    depends_on:
      frontend:
        condition: service_healthy
      backend:
        condition: service_healthy
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "nginx", "-t"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 10s
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

networks:
  dateapp-network:
    driver: bridge
    ipam:
      config:
        - subnet: 172.28.0.0/16

volumes:
  postgres_data:
    driver: local
  redis_data:
    driver: local
  ollama_data:
    driver: local
  backend_uploads:
    driver: local
  backend_logs:
    driver: local
  nginx_logs:
    driver: local
"}
[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/Dockerfile.backend","content":"# Backend Dockerfile for Node.js API
# Multi-stage build for production optimization

# ============================================
# Stage 1: Dependencies
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS deps

# Install build dependencies for native modules
RUN apk add --no-cache libc6-compat python3 make g++

WORKDIR /app

# Copy package files
COPY package*.json ./
COPY yarn.lock* ./
COPY pnpm-lock.yaml* ./

# Install dependencies based on lockfile
RUN \
  if [ -f yarn.lock ]; then yarn install --frozen-lockfile --production=false; \
  elif [ -f pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then corepack enable pnpm && pnpm install --frozen-lockfile; \
  elif [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; \
  else npm install; \
  fi

# ============================================
# Stage 2: Builder
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS builder

WORKDIR /app

# Copy dependencies from deps stage
COPY --from=deps /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY . .

# Generate Prisma client if prisma schema exists
RUN if [ -f prisma/schema.prisma ]; then npx prisma generate; fi

# Build TypeScript if tsconfig exists
RUN \
  if [ -f tsconfig.json ]; then npm run build; \
  fi

# Prune dev dependencies
RUN \
  if [ -f yarn.lock ]; then yarn install --frozen-lockfile --production; \
  elif [ -f pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then corepack enable pnpm && pnpm prune --prod; \
  elif [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci --only=production; \
  else npm prune --production; \
  fi

# ============================================
# Stage 3: Production Runner
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS runner

# Set environment
ARG NODE_ENV=production
ENV NODE_ENV=${NODE_ENV}

# Install runtime dependencies
RUN apk add --no-cache \
  curl \
  dumb-init \
  && rm -rf /var/cache/apk/*

# Create non-root user for security
RUN addgroup --system --gid 1001 nodejs \
  && adduser --system --uid 1001 nodeuser

WORKDIR /app

# Copy built application
COPY --from=builder --chown=nodeuser:nodejs /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY --from=builder --chown=nodeuser:nodejs /app/dist ./dist
COPY --from=builder --chown=nodeuser:nodejs /app/package.json ./package.json

# Copy Prisma files if they exist
COPY --from=builder --chown=nodeuser:nodejs /app/prisma ./prisma

# Create necessary directories
RUN mkdir -p /app/uploads /app/logs \
  && chown -R nodeuser:nodejs /app/uploads /app/logs

# Set user
USER nodeuser

# Expose port
EXPOSE 3001

# Health check
HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=40s --retries=3 \
  CMD curl -f http://localhost:3001/health || exit 1

# Use dumb-init to handle signals properly
ENTRYPOINT ["dumb-init", "--"]

# Start the application
CMD ["node", "dist/index.js"]
"}
[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/Dockerfile.frontend","content":"# Frontend Dockerfile for Next.js Application
# Multi-stage build for production optimization

# ============================================
# Stage 1: Dependencies
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS deps

# Install libc6-compat for Alpine compatibility
RUN apk add --no-cache libc6-compat

WORKDIR /app

# Copy package files
COPY package*.json ./
COPY yarn.lock* ./
COPY pnpm-lock.yaml* ./

# Install dependencies based on lockfile
RUN \
  if [ -f yarn.lock ]; then yarn install --frozen-lockfile; \
  elif [ -f pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then corepack enable pnpm && pnpm install --frozen-lockfile; \
  elif [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; \
  else npm install; \
  fi

# ============================================
# Stage 2: Builder
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS builder

WORKDIR /app

# Copy dependencies
COPY --from=deps /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY . .

# Set build-time environment variables
ARG NODE_ENV=production
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME

ENV NODE_ENV=${NODE_ENV}
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=${NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL}
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL=${NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL}
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME=${NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME}
ENV NEXT_TELEMETRY_DISABLED=1

# Build the application
RUN npm run build

# ============================================
# Stage 3: Production Runner
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS runner

WORKDIR /app

# Set environment
ARG NODE_ENV=production
ENV NODE_ENV=${NODE_ENV}
ENV NEXT_TELEMETRY_DISABLED=1

# Install runtime dependencies
RUN apk add --no-cache \
  curl \
  dumb-init \
  && rm -rf /var/cache/apk/*

# Create non-root user for security
RUN addgroup --system --gid 1001 nodejs \
  && adduser --system --uid 1001 nextjs

# Copy public assets
COPY --from=builder /app/public ./public

# Set correct permissions for prerender cache
RUN mkdir .next \
  && chown nextjs:nodejs .next

# Copy standalone build (if using output: 'standalone')
# Uncomment these lines if using standalone mode in next.config.js
# COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/standalone ./
# COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/static ./.next/static

# Copy full .next build (standard mode)
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next ./.next
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/package.json ./package.json

# Set runtime environment variables
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME

ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=${NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL}
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL=${NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL}
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME=${NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME}

# Switch to non-root user
USER nextjs

# Expose port
EXPOSE 3000

# Set hostname for container
ENV HOSTNAME="0.0.0.0"
ENV PORT=3000

# Health check
HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=60s --retries=3 \
  CMD curl -f http://localhost:3000 || exit 1

# Use dumb-init to handle signals properly
ENTRYPOINT ["dumb-init", "--"]

# Start Next.js
CMD ["npm", "start"]
"}

POSTGRES_DB=dateapp

JWT_REFRESH_SECRET=your_super_secure_refresh_secret_minimum_32_characters
JWT_EXPIRES_IN=15m

# -----------------------------------------

NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=http://localhost:3001
NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL=ws://localhost:3001

# LOG_LEVEL=info

# -----------------------------------------
# Development Only

# NODE_ENV=development
# DEBUG=*
"}

[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/nginx/nginx.conf","content":"# Nginx Main Configuration for DateApp
# Production-ready configuration with security headers and optimizations

user nginx;
worker_processes auto;
error_log /var/log/nginx/error.log warn;
pid /var/run/nginx.pid;

# Maximum number of open files per worker process
worker_rlimit_nofile 65535;

events {
    worker_connections 4096;
    use epoll;
    multi_accept on;
}

http {
    # Basic Settings
    include /etc/nginx/mime.types;
    default_type application/octet-stream;

    # Logging Format
    log_format main '$remote_addr - $remote_user [$time_local] "$request" '
                    '$status $body_bytes_sent "$http_referer" '
                    '"$http_user_agent" "$http_x_forwarded_for" '
                    'rt=$request_time uct="$upstream_connect_time" '
                    'uht="$upstream_header_time" urt="$upstream_response_time"';

    log_format json_combined escape=json '{'
        '"time_local":"$time_local",'
        '"remote_addr":"$remote_addr",'
        '"remote_user":"$remote_user",'
        '"request":"$request",'
        '"status": "$status",'
        '"body_bytes_sent":"$body_bytes_sent",'
        '"request_time":"$request_time",'
        '"http_referrer":"$http_referer",'
        '"http_user_agent":"$http_user_agent",'
        '"http_x_forwarded_for":"$http_x_forwarded_for"'
    '}';

    access_log /var/log/nginx/access.log main;

    # Performance Optimizations
    sendfile on;
    tcp_nopush on;
    tcp_nodelay on;
    keepalive_timeout 65;
    types_hash_max_size 2048;
    server_tokens off;

    # Buffer Sizes
    client_body_buffer_size 16k;
    client_header_buffer_size 1k;
    client_max_body_size 50M;
    large_client_header_buffers 4 8k;

    # Timeouts
    client_body_timeout 60;
    client_header_timeout 60;
    send_timeout 60;

    # Gzip Compression
    gzip on;
    gzip_vary on;
    gzip_proxied any;
    gzip_comp_level 6;
    gzip_buffers 16 8k;
    gzip_http_version 1.1;
    gzip_min_length 256;
    gzip_types
        application/atom+xml
        application/geo+json
        application/javascript
        application/x-javascript
        application/json
        application/ld+json
        application/manifest+json
        application/rdf+xml
        application/rss+xml
        application/xhtml+xml
        application/xml
        font/eot
        font/otf
        font/ttf
        image/svg+xml
        text/css
        text/javascript
        text/plain
        text/xml;

    # Rate Limiting Zones
    limit_req_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=general:10m rate=10r/s;
    limit_req_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=api:10m rate=30r/s;
    limit_req_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=auth:10m rate=5r/s;
    limit_conn_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=conn_limit:10m;

    # Upstream Definitions
    upstream frontend {
        server frontend:3000;
        keepalive 32;
    }

    upstream backend {
        server backend:3001;
        keepalive 32;
    }

    # Security Headers Map
    map $sent_http_content_type $content_type_options {
        default "nosniff";
    }

    map $sent_http_content_type $frame_options {
        default "DENY";
    }

    # Include server configurations
    include /etc/nginx/conf.d/*.conf;
}
"}
[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/nginx/conf.d/default.conf","content":"# DateApp Server Configuration

# HTTP Server - Redirect to HTTPS in production
server {
    listen 80;
    listen [::]:80;
    server_name localhost _;

    # Health check endpoint for load balancers
    location /nginx-health {
        access_log off;
        return 200 "healthy\n";
        add_header Content-Type text/plain;
    }

    # In production, uncomment to redirect all HTTP to HTTPS
    # return 301 https://$server_name$request_uri;

    # For development/testing, include the main location blocks
    include /etc/nginx/conf.d/locations.conf;
}

[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/nginx/conf.d/locations.conf","content":"# Location blocks for DateApp
# Included by both HTTP and HTTPS server blocks

# Security Headers
add_header X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff" always;
add_header X-Frame-Options "SAMEORIGIN" always;
add_header X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block" always;
add_header Referrer-Policy "strict-origin-when-cross-origin" always;
add_header Permissions-Policy "camera=(), microphone=(), geolocation=(self), payment=()" always;

# Content Security Policy (adjust as needed)
# add_header Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self'; script-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline' 'unsafe-eval'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data: blob:; font-src 'self' data:; connect-src 'self' ws: wss:; frame-ancestors 'none';" always;

# Root location - Forward to frontend
location / {
    limit_req zone=general burst=20 nodelay;
    limit_conn conn_limit 20;

    proxy_pass http://frontend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection 'upgrade';
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Port $server_port;
    proxy_cache_bypass $http_upgrade;
    proxy_read_timeout 86400;

    # Enable WebSocket support for hot reload in development
    proxy_connect_timeout 7d;
    proxy_send_timeout 7d;
}

# API routes - Forward to backend
location /api {
    limit_req zone=api burst=50 nodelay;
    limit_conn conn_limit 30;

    # Remove /api prefix when forwarding
    rewrite ^/api/(.*)$ /$1 break;

    proxy_pass http://backend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_set_header X-Request-ID $request_id;
    proxy_connect_timeout 60s;
    proxy_send_timeout 60s;
    proxy_read_timeout 60s;

    # Don't buffer for streaming responses
    proxy_buffering off;
}

# Auth routes - Stricter rate limiting
location /api/auth {
    limit_req zone=auth burst=10 nodelay;
    limit_conn conn_limit 10;

    rewrite ^/api/(.*)$ /$1 break;

    proxy_pass http://backend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_set_header X-Request-ID $request_id;
}

# WebSocket endpoint for real-time features
location /ws {
    proxy_pass http://backend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_read_timeout 86400;
    proxy_send_timeout 86400;
    proxy_connect_timeout 7d;
}

# Socket.IO endpoint
location /socket.io {
    proxy_pass http://backend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
    proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
    proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    proxy_read_timeout 86400;
    proxy_send_timeout 86400;
}

# Health check endpoint
location /health {
    proxy_pass http://backend/health;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    access_log off;
}

# Backend health (for internal monitoring)
location /api/health {
    proxy_pass http://backend/health;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    access_log off;
}

# Static files with caching
location ~* \.(jpg|jpeg|png|gif|ico|svg|webp|woff|woff2|ttf|eot|otf)$ {
    proxy_pass http://frontend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    expires 30d;
    add_header Cache-Control "public, immutable";
    access_log off;
}

# Next.js static assets
location /_next/static {
    proxy_pass http://frontend;
    proxy_http_version 1.1;
    proxy_set_header Host $host;
    expires 365d;
    add_header Cache-Control "public, immutable";
    access_log off;
}

# Uploaded files (if served directly)
location /uploads {
    alias /app/uploads;
    expires 30d;
    add_header Cache-Control "public";

    # Security: prevent script execution
    location ~* \.(php|pl|py|jsp|asp|sh|cgi)$ {
        deny all;
    }
}

# Favicon
location = /favicon.ico {
    proxy_pass http://frontend;
    log_not_found off;
    access_log off;
}

# Robots.txt
location = /robots.txt {
    proxy_pass http://frontend;
    log_not_found off;
    access_log off;
}

# Block access to sensitive files
location ~ /\. {
    deny all;
    access_log off;
    log_not_found off;
}

location ~ ^/(\.env|\.git|\.htaccess|\.htpasswd|composer\.(json|lock)|package(-lock)?\.json|yarn\.lock) {
    deny all;
    access_log off;
    log_not_found off;
}

# Error pages
error_page 500 502 503 504 /50x.html;
location = /50x.html {
    root /usr/share/nginx/html;
    internal;
}

error_page 404 /404.html;
location = /404.html {
    root /usr/share/nginx/html;
    internal;
}
"}

<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Service Temporarily Unavailable - DateApp</title>
    <style>
        * {
            margin: 0;
            padding: 0;
            box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        body {
            font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, 'Helvetica Neue', Arial, sans-serif;
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%);
            min-height: 100vh;
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: center;
            padding: 20px;
        }
        .container {
            background: white;
            border-radius: 20px;
            padding: 60px 40px;
            text-align: center;
            max-width: 500px;
            box-shadow: 0 25px 50px -12px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25);
        }
        .icon {
            font-size: 80px;
            margin-bottom: 20px;
        }
        h1 {
            color: #1a1a2e;
            font-size: 28px;
            margin-bottom: 15px;
        }
        p {
            color: #666;
            font-size: 16px;
            line-height: 1.6;
            margin-bottom: 30px;
        }
        .btn {
            display: inline-block;
            padding: 14px 32px;
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%);
            color: white;
            text-decoration: none;
            border-radius: 30px;
            font-weight: 600;
            transition: transform 0.2s, box-shadow 0.2s;
        }
        .btn:hover {
            transform: translateY(-2px);
            box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(102, 126, 234, 0.4);
        }
        .status {
            margin-top: 30px;
            padding: 15px;
            background: #f8f9fa;
            border-radius: 10px;
            font-size: 14px;
            color: #888;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <div class="container">
        <div class="icon">😬</div>
        <h1>We'll Be Right Back</h1>
        <p>Our servers are taking a quick break. We're working hard to get everything back up and running.</p>
        <a href="/" class="btn">Try Again</a>
        <div class="status">
            If this persists, please try again in a few minutes.
        </div>
    </div>
</body>
</html>
"}

[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/init-scripts/01-init.sql","content":"-- DateApp Database Initialization Script
-- This script runs when the PostgreSQL container is first created

-- Enable required extensions
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "uuid-ossp";
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "pgcrypto";
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS "pg_trgm";

-- Create custom types
DO $$ BEGIN
    CREATE TYPE gender AS ENUM ('male', 'female', 'non_binary', 'other', 'prefer_not_to_say');
EXCEPTION
    WHEN duplicate_object THEN null;
END $$;

DO $$ BEGIN
    CREATE TYPE relationship_goal AS ENUM ('casual', 'dating', 'relationship', 'marriage', 'friendship');
EXCEPTION
    WHEN duplicate_object THEN null;
END $$;

DO $$ BEGIN
    CREATE TYPE match_status AS ENUM ('pending', 'matched', 'rejected', 'expired');
EXCEPTION
    WHEN duplicate_object THEN null;
END $$;

DO $$ BEGIN
    CREATE TYPE message_status AS ENUM ('sent', 'delivered', 'read');
EXCEPTION
    WHEN duplicate_object THEN null;
END $$;

-- Grant permissions (the main user is created by POSTGRES_USER env var)
-- Additional grants can be added here for read-only users, etc.

-- Create indexes function for better query performance
-- These will be properly created by Prisma migrations, but we set up the basics

-- Log initialization complete
DO $$
BEGIN
    RAISE NOTICE 'DateApp database initialization complete!';
END $$;
"}

[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/docker-compose.override.yml","content":"# Docker Compose Override for Development
# This file automatically extends docker-compose.yml when both are present
# Use: docker-compose up (will use both files)
# For production only: docker-compose -f docker-compose.yml up

version: '3.8'

services:
  # Development PostgreSQL with debug logging
  postgres:
    environment:
      POSTGRES_HOST_AUTH_METHOD: trust
    command:
      - "postgres"
      - "-c"
      - "log_statement=all"
      - "-c"
      - "log_destination=stderr"

  # Redis without password for development
  redis:
    command: redis-server --appendonly yes
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "redis-cli", "ping"]

  # Ollama without GPU requirement for development
  ollama:
    deploy:
      resources:
        reservations:
          devices: []

  # Backend with hot reload
  backend:
    build:
      args:
        NODE_ENV: development
    environment:
      NODE_ENV: development
      DEBUG: "*"
    volumes:
      - ../backend/src:/app/src:ro
      - ../backend/package.json:/app/package.json:ro
    command: npm run dev

  # Frontend with hot reload
  frontend:
    build:
      args:
        NODE_ENV: development
    environment:
      NODE_ENV: development
      WATCHPACK_POLLING: "true"
    volumes:
      - ../frontend/src:/app/src:ro
      - ../frontend/public:/app/public:ro
      - ../frontend/package.json:/app/package.json:ro
    command: npm run dev

  # Nginx for development (no SSL)
  nginx:
    volumes:
      - ./nginx/dev.conf:/etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf:ro

  # Additional development tools
  adminer:
    image: adminer:latest
    container_name: dateapp-adminer
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    environment:
      ADMINER_DEFAULT_SERVER: postgres
      ADMINER_DESIGN: dracula
    depends_on:
      - postgres
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Redis Commander for Redis management
  redis-commander:
    image: rediscommander/redis-commander:latest
    container_name: dateapp-redis-commander
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "8081:8081"
    environment:
      REDIS_HOSTS: local:redis:6379
    depends_on:
      - redis
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # MailHog for email testing
  mailhog:
    image: mailhog/mailhog:latest
    container_name: dateapp-mailhog
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "1025:1025"  # SMTP
      - "8025:8025"  # Web UI
    networks:
      - dateapp-network
"}
[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/nginx/dev.conf","content":"# Development Nginx Configuration
# Simplified configuration without SSL for local development

server {
    listen 80;
    listen [::]:80;
    server_name localhost _;

    # Larger body size for development
    client_max_body_size 100M;

    # Disable rate limiting in development
    # limit_req zone=general burst=100 nodelay;

    # Health check
    location /nginx-health {
        access_log off;
        return 200 "healthy\n";
        add_header Content-Type text/plain;
    }

    # Frontend with hot reload support
    location / {
        proxy_pass http://frontend:3000;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection 'upgrade';
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
        proxy_cache_bypass $http_upgrade;

        # Long timeout for hot reload
        proxy_read_timeout 86400;
        proxy_connect_timeout 86400;
        proxy_send_timeout 86400;
    }

    # Next.js HMR WebSocket
    location /_next/webpack-hmr {
        proxy_pass http://frontend:3000/_next/webpack-hmr;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_read_timeout 86400;
    }

    # API routes
    location /api {
        rewrite ^/api/(.*)$ /$1 break;
        proxy_pass http://backend:3001;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
        proxy_read_timeout 300s;
    }

    # WebSocket
    location /ws {
        proxy_pass http://backend:3001;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_read_timeout 86400;
    }

    # Socket.IO
    location /socket.io {
        proxy_pass http://backend:3001;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_read_timeout 86400;
    }

    # Health checks
    location /health {
        proxy_pass http://backend:3001/health;
        access_log off;
    }

    # Adminer (database management)
    location /adminer/ {
        proxy_pass http://adminer:8080/;
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    }

    # Redis Commander
    location /redis/ {
        proxy_pass http://redis-commander:8081/;
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
    }

    # MailHog
    location /mail/ {
        proxy_pass http://mailhog:8025/;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection "upgrade";
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
    }
}
"}

[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/Makefile","content":"# DateApp Docker Makefile
# Usage: make <target>

.PHONY: help build up down restart logs ps clean prune shell db-shell redis-shell backup restore

# Default target
help:
	@echo "DateApp Docker Commands"
	@echo "========================"
	@echo ""
	@echo "Development:"
	@echo "  make dev          - Start all services in development mode"
	@echo "  make dev-build    - Rebuild and start in development mode"
	@echo "  make dev-logs     - View development logs"
	@echo ""
	@echo "Production:"
	@echo "  make prod         - Start all services in production mode"
	@echo "  make prod-build   - Rebuild and start in production mode"
	@echo ""
	@echo "General:"
	@echo "  make up           - Start all services"
	@echo "  make down         - Stop all services"
	@echo "  make restart      - Restart all services"
	@echo "  make build        - Build all images"
	@echo "  make logs         - View all logs"
	@echo "  make ps           - List running containers"
	@echo ""
	@echo "Database:"
	@echo "  make db-shell     - Open PostgreSQL shell"
	@echo "  make db-backup    - Backup database"
	@echo "  make db-restore   - Restore database (requires BACKUP_FILE)"
	@echo "  make db-migrate   - Run database migrations"
	@echo ""
	@echo "Redis:"
	@echo "  make redis-shell  - Open Redis CLI"
	@echo "  make redis-flush  - Flush Redis cache"
	@echo ""
	@echo "Maintenance:"
	@echo "  make clean        - Remove stopped containers"
	@echo "  make prune        - Remove unused Docker resources"
	@echo "  make shell        - Open shell in backend container"

# Development
dev:
	docker-compose up

dev-build:
	docker-compose up --build

dev-logs:
	docker-compose logs -f

# Production (without override file)
prod:
	docker-compose -f docker-compose.yml up -d

prod-build:
	docker-compose -f docker-compose.yml up -d --build

# General commands
up:
	docker-compose up -d

down:
	docker-compose down

restart:
	docker-compose restart

build:
	docker-compose build

logs:
	docker-compose logs -f

ps:
	docker-compose ps

# Service-specific logs
logs-backend:
	docker-compose logs -f backend

logs-frontend:
	docker-compose logs -f frontend

logs-nginx:
	docker-compose logs -f nginx

logs-postgres:
	docker-compose logs -f postgres

logs-redis:
	docker-compose logs -f redis

logs-ollama:
	docker-compose logs -f ollama

# Database operations
db-shell:
	docker-compose exec postgres psql -U $${POSTGRES_USER:-dateapp} -d $${POSTGRES_DB:-dateapp}

db-backup:
	@mkdir -p ./backups
	docker-compose exec postgres pg_dump -U $${POSTGRES_USER:-dateapp} $${POSTGRES_DB:-dateapp} > ./backups/backup_$$(date +%Y%m%d_%H%M%S).sql
	@echo "Backup created in ./backups/"

db-restore:
	@if [ -z "$(BACKUP_FILE)" ]; then echo "Usage: make db-restore BACKUP_FILE=./backups/backup.sql"; exit 1; fi
	docker-compose exec -T postgres psql -U $${POSTGRES_USER:-dateapp} -d $${POSTGRES_DB:-dateapp} < $(BACKUP_FILE)
	@echo "Database restored from $(BACKUP_FILE)"

db-migrate:
	docker-compose exec backend npx prisma migrate deploy

db-seed:
	docker-compose exec backend npx prisma db seed

# Redis operations
redis-shell:
	docker-compose exec redis redis-cli -a $${REDIS_PASSWORD}

redis-flush:
	docker-compose exec redis redis-cli -a $${REDIS_PASSWORD} FLUSHALL
	@echo "Redis cache flushed"

# Shell access
shell:
	docker-compose exec backend sh

shell-frontend:
	docker-compose exec frontend sh

# Ollama operations
ollama-pull:
	docker-compose exec ollama ollama pull $${OLLAMA_MODEL:-llama3.2}

ollama-list:
	docker-compose exec ollama ollama list

# Cleanup
clean:
	docker-compose down --remove-orphans
	docker container prune -f

prune:
	docker system prune -f
	docker volume prune -f

# Full reset (DANGEROUS - removes all data)
reset:
	@echo "WARNING: This will delete all data including the database!"
	@read -p "Are you sure? [y/N] " confirm && [ "$$confirm" = "y" ] || exit 1
	docker-compose down -v --remove-orphans
	docker system prune -f

# Health check
health:
	@echo "Checking service health..."
	@docker-compose ps
	@echo ""
	@echo "Backend health:"
	@curl -s http://localhost:3001/health || echo "Backend not responding"
	@echo ""
	@echo "Frontend health:"
	@curl -s http://localhost:3000 > /dev/null && echo "Frontend OK" || echo "Frontend not responding"
	@echo ""
	@echo "Nginx health:"
	@curl -s http://localhost/nginx-health || echo "Nginx not responding"
"}

[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/docker-compose.yml","content":"version: '3.8'

services:
  # PostgreSQL Database
  postgres:
    image: postgres:16-alpine
    container_name: dateapp-postgres
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: ${POSTGRES_USER:-dateapp}
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${POSTGRES_PASSWORD:?POSTGRES_PASSWORD is required}
      POSTGRES_DB: ${POSTGRES_DB:-dateapp}
      PGDATA: /var/lib/postgresql/data/pgdata
    ports:
      - "${POSTGRES_PORT:-5432}:5432"
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
      - ./init-scripts:/docker-entrypoint-initdb.d:ro
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "pg_isready -U ${POSTGRES_USER:-dateapp} -d ${POSTGRES_DB:-dateapp}"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5
      start_period: 30s
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Redis Cache & Session Store
  redis:
    image: redis:7-alpine
    container_name: dateapp-redis
    restart: unless-stopped
    command: redis-server --appendonly yes --requirepass ${REDIS_PASSWORD:?REDIS_PASSWORD is required}
    ports:
      - "${REDIS_PORT:-6379}:6379"
    volumes:
      - redis_data:/data
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "redis-cli", "-a", "${REDIS_PASSWORD}", "ping"]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5
      start_period: 10s
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Ollama - Llama AI Service
  ollama:
    image: ollama/ollama:latest
    container_name: dateapp-ollama
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "${OLLAMA_PORT:-11434}:11434"
    volumes:
      - ollama_data:/root/.ollama
    environment:
      - OLLAMA_HOST=0.0.0.0
      - OLLAMA_ORIGINS=*
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -f http://localhost:11434/api/tags || exit 1"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 60s
    deploy:
      resources:
        reservations:
          devices:
            - driver: nvidia
              count: all
              capabilities: [gpu]
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Node.js Backend API
  backend:
    build:
      context: ../backend
      dockerfile: ../docker/Dockerfile.backend
      args:
        NODE_ENV: ${NODE_ENV:-production}
    container_name: dateapp-backend
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      NODE_ENV: ${NODE_ENV:-production}
      PORT: 3001
      DATABASE_URL: postgresql://${POSTGRES_USER:-dateapp}:${POSTGRES_PASSWORD}@postgres:5432/${POSTGRES_DB:-dateapp}?schema=public
      REDIS_URL: redis://:${REDIS_PASSWORD}@redis:6379
      REDIS_HOST: redis
      REDIS_PORT: 6379
      REDIS_PASSWORD: ${REDIS_PASSWORD}
      JWT_SECRET: ${JWT_SECRET:?JWT_SECRET is required}
      JWT_REFRESH_SECRET: ${JWT_REFRESH_SECRET:?JWT_REFRESH_SECRET is required}
      JWT_EXPIRES_IN: ${JWT_EXPIRES_IN:-15m}
      JWT_REFRESH_EXPIRES_IN: ${JWT_REFRESH_EXPIRES_IN:-7d}
      OLLAMA_BASE_URL: http://ollama:11434
      OLLAMA_MODEL: ${OLLAMA_MODEL:-llama3.2}
      CORS_ORIGIN: ${CORS_ORIGIN:-http://localhost:3000}
      UPLOAD_DIR: /app/uploads
      MAX_FILE_SIZE: ${MAX_FILE_SIZE:-10485760}
      RATE_LIMIT_WINDOW_MS: ${RATE_LIMIT_WINDOW_MS:-900000}
      RATE_LIMIT_MAX_REQUESTS: ${RATE_LIMIT_MAX_REQUESTS:-100}
    ports:
      - "${BACKEND_PORT:-3001}:3001"
    volumes:
      - backend_uploads:/app/uploads
      - backend_logs:/app/logs
    depends_on:
      postgres:
        condition: service_healthy
      redis:
        condition: service_healthy
      ollama:
        condition: service_started
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -f http://localhost:3001/health || exit 1"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 40s
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Next.js Frontend
  frontend:
    build:
      context: ../frontend
      dockerfile: ../docker/Dockerfile.frontend
      args:
        NODE_ENV: ${NODE_ENV:-production}
        NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL:-http://localhost:3001}
        NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL:-ws://localhost:3001}
        NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME:-DateApp}
    container_name: dateapp-frontend
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      NODE_ENV: ${NODE_ENV:-production}
      NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL:-http://localhost:3001}
      NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL:-ws://localhost:3001}
      NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME: ${NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME:-DateApp}
    ports:
      - "${FRONTEND_PORT:-3000}:3000"
    depends_on:
      backend:
        condition: service_healthy
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD-SHELL", "curl -f http://localhost:3000 || exit 1"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 60s
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

  # Nginx Reverse Proxy
  nginx:
    image: nginx:alpine
    container_name: dateapp-nginx
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "${NGINX_HTTP_PORT:-80}:80"
      - "${NGINX_HTTPS_PORT:-443}:443"
    volumes:
      - ./nginx/nginx.conf:/etc/nginx/nginx.conf:ro
      - ./nginx/conf.d:/etc/nginx/conf.d:ro
      - ./nginx/ssl:/etc/nginx/ssl:ro
      - nginx_logs:/var/log/nginx
      - ./nginx/html:/usr/share/nginx/html:ro
    depends_on:
      frontend:
        condition: service_healthy
      backend:
        condition: service_healthy
    healthcheck:
      test: ["CMD", "nginx", "-t"]
      interval: 30s
      timeout: 10s
      retries: 3
      start_period: 10s
    networks:
      - dateapp-network

networks:
  dateapp-network:
    driver: bridge
    ipam:
      config:
        - subnet: 172.28.0.0/16

volumes:
  postgres_data:
    driver: local
  redis_data:
    driver: local
  ollama_data:
    driver: local
  backend_uploads:
    driver: local
  backend_logs:
    driver: local
  nginx_logs:
    driver: local
"}
[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/Dockerfile.backend","content":"# Backend Dockerfile for Node.js API
# Multi-stage build for production optimization

# ============================================
# Stage 1: Dependencies
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS deps

# Install build dependencies for native modules
RUN apk add --no-cache libc6-compat python3 make g++

WORKDIR /app

# Copy package files
COPY package*.json ./
COPY yarn.lock* ./
COPY pnpm-lock.yaml* ./

# Install dependencies based on lockfile
RUN \
  if [ -f yarn.lock ]; then yarn install --frozen-lockfile --production=false; \
  elif [ -f pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then corepack enable pnpm && pnpm install --frozen-lockfile; \
  elif [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; \
  else npm install; \
  fi

# ============================================
# Stage 2: Builder
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS builder

WORKDIR /app

# Copy dependencies from deps stage
COPY --from=deps /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY . .

# Generate Prisma client if prisma schema exists
RUN if [ -f prisma/schema.prisma ]; then npx prisma generate; fi

# Build TypeScript if tsconfig exists
RUN \
  if [ -f tsconfig.json ]; then npm run build; \
  fi

# Prune dev dependencies
RUN \
  if [ -f yarn.lock ]; then yarn install --frozen-lockfile --production; \
  elif [ -f pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then corepack enable pnpm && pnpm prune --prod; \
  elif [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci --only=production; \
  else npm prune --production; \
  fi

# ============================================
# Stage 3: Production Runner
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS runner

# Set environment
ARG NODE_ENV=production
ENV NODE_ENV=${NODE_ENV}

# Install runtime dependencies
RUN apk add --no-cache \
  curl \
  dumb-init \
  && rm -rf /var/cache/apk/*

# Create non-root user for security
RUN addgroup --system --gid 1001 nodejs \
  && adduser --system --uid 1001 nodeuser

WORKDIR /app

# Copy built application
COPY --from=builder --chown=nodeuser:nodejs /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY --from=builder --chown=nodeuser:nodejs /app/dist ./dist
COPY --from=builder --chown=nodeuser:nodejs /app/package.json ./package.json

# Copy Prisma files if they exist
COPY --from=builder --chown=nodeuser:nodejs /app/prisma ./prisma

# Create necessary directories
RUN mkdir -p /app/uploads /app/logs \
  && chown -R nodeuser:nodejs /app/uploads /app/logs

# Set user
USER nodeuser

# Expose port
EXPOSE 3001

# Health check
HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=40s --retries=3 \
  CMD curl -f http://localhost:3001/health || exit 1

# Use dumb-init to handle signals properly
ENTRYPOINT ["dumb-init", "--"]

# Start the application
CMD ["node", "dist/index.js"]
"}
[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/Dockerfile.frontend","content":"# Frontend Dockerfile for Next.js Application
# Multi-stage build for production optimization

# ============================================
# Stage 1: Dependencies
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS deps

# Install libc6-compat for Alpine compatibility
RUN apk add --no-cache libc6-compat

WORKDIR /app

# Copy package files
COPY package*.json ./
COPY yarn.lock* ./
COPY pnpm-lock.yaml* ./

# Install dependencies based on lockfile
RUN \
  if [ -f yarn.lock ]; then yarn install --frozen-lockfile; \
  elif [ -f pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then corepack enable pnpm && pnpm install --frozen-lockfile; \
  elif [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; \
  else npm install; \
  fi

# ============================================
# Stage 2: Builder
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS builder

WORKDIR /app

# Copy dependencies
COPY --from=deps /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY . .

# Set build-time environment variables
ARG NODE_ENV=production
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME

ENV NODE_ENV=${NODE_ENV}
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=${NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL}
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL=${NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL}
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME=${NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME}
ENV NEXT_TELEMETRY_DISABLED=1

# Build the application
RUN npm run build

# ============================================
# Stage 3: Production Runner
# ============================================
FROM node:20-alpine AS runner

WORKDIR /app

# Set environment
ARG NODE_ENV=production
ENV NODE_ENV=${NODE_ENV}
ENV NEXT_TELEMETRY_DISABLED=1

# Install runtime dependencies
RUN apk add --no-cache \
  curl \
  dumb-init \
  && rm -rf /var/cache/apk/*

# Create non-root user for security
RUN addgroup --system --gid 1001 nodejs \
  && adduser --system --uid 1001 nextjs

# Copy public assets
COPY --from=builder /app/public ./public

# Set correct permissions for prerender cache
RUN mkdir .next \
  && chown nextjs:nodejs .next

# Copy standalone build (if using output: 'standalone')
# Uncomment these lines if using standalone mode in next.config.js
# COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/standalone ./
# COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/static ./.next/static

# Copy full .next build (standard mode)
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next ./.next
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/node_modules ./node_modules
COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/package.json ./package.json

# Set runtime environment variables
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL
ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME

ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=${NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL}
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL=${NEXT_PUBLIC_WS_URL}
ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME=${NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME}

# Switch to non-root user
USER nextjs

# Expose port
EXPOSE 3000

# Set hostname for container
ENV HOSTNAME="0.0.0.0"
ENV PORT=3000

# Health check
HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=60s --retries=3 \
  CMD curl -f http://localhost:3000 || exit 1

# Use dumb-init to handle signals properly
ENTRYPOINT ["dumb-init", "--"]

# Start Next.js
CMD ["npm", "start"]
"}

[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/nginx/nginx.conf","content":"# Nginx Main Configuration for DateApp
# Production-ready configuration with security headers and optimizations

user nginx;
worker_processes auto;
error_log /var/log/nginx/error.log warn;
pid /var/run/nginx.pid;

# Maximum number of open files per worker process
worker_rlimit_nofile 65535;

events {
    worker_connections 4096;
    use epoll;
    multi_accept on;
}

http {
    # Basic Settings
    include /etc/nginx/mime.types;
    default_type application/octet-stream;

    # Logging Format
    log_format main '$remote_addr - $remote_user [$time_local] "$request" '
                    '$status $body_bytes_sent "$http_referer" '
                    '"$http_user_agent" "$http_x_forwarded_for" '
                    'rt=$request_time uct="$upstream_connect_time" '
                    'uht="$upstream_header_time" urt="$upstream_response_time"';

    log_format json_combined escape=json '{'
        '"time_local":"$time_local",'
        '"remote_addr":"$remote_addr",'
        '"remote_user":"$remote_user",'
        '"request":"$request",'
        '"status": "$status",'
        '"body_bytes_sent":"$body_bytes_sent",'
        '"request_time":"$request_time",'
        '"http_referrer":"$http_referer",'
        '"http_user_agent":"$http_user_agent",'
        '"http_x_forwarded_for":"$http_x_forwarded_for"'
    '}';

    access_log /var/log/nginx/access.log main;

    # Performance Optimizations
    sendfile on;
    tcp_nopush on;
    tcp_nodelay on;
    keepalive_timeout 65;
    types_hash_max_size 2048;
    server_tokens off;

    # Buffer Sizes
    client_body_buffer_size 16k;
    client_header_buffer_size 1k;
    client_max_body_size 50M;
    large_client_header_buffers 4 8k;

    # Timeouts
    client_body_timeout 60;
    client_header_timeout 60;
    send_timeout 60;

    # Gzip Compression
    gzip on;
    gzip_vary on;
    gzip_proxied any;
    gzip_comp_level 6;
    gzip_buffers 16 8k;
    gzip_http_version 1.1;
    gzip_min_length 256;
    gzip_types
        application/atom+xml
        application/geo+json
        application/javascript
        application/x-javascript
        application/json
        application/ld+json
        application/manifest+json
        application/rdf+xml
        application/rss+xml
        application/xhtml+xml
        application/xml
        font/eot
        font/otf
        font/ttf
        image/svg+xml
        text/css
        text/javascript
        text/plain
        text/xml;

    # Rate Limiting Zones
    limit_req_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=general:10m rate=10r/s;
    limit_req_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=api:10m rate=30r/s;
    limit_req_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=auth:10m rate=5r/s;
    limit_conn_zone $binary_remote_addr zone=conn_limit:10m;

    # Upstream Definitions
    upstream frontend {
        server frontend:3000;
        keepalive 32;
    }

    upstream backend {
        server backend:3001;
        keepalive 32;
    }

    # Security Headers Map
    map $sent_http_content_type $content_type_options {
        default "nosniff";
    }

    map $sent_http_content_type $frame_options {
        default "DENY";
    }

    # Include server configurations
    include /etc/nginx/conf.d/*.conf;
}
"}
[Tool: Write] {"file_path":"C:/Users/joshl/date-app/docker/nginx/conf.d/default.conf","content":"# DateApp Server Configuration

# HTTP Server - Redirect to HTTPS in production
server {
    listen 80;
    listen [::]:80;
    server_name localhost _;

    # Health check endpoint for load balancers
    location /nginx-health {
        access_log off;
        return 200 "healthy\n";
        add_header Content-Type text/plain;
    }

    # In production, uncomment to redirect all HTTP to HTTPS
    # return 301 https://$server_name$request_uri;

    # For development/testing, include the main location blocks
    include /etc/nginx/conf.d/locations.conf;
}
